name: openai
light service
openai
split entity_id
notification ha
prompt
template:
You will generate a json to configure some lights.  Your answer has to be a valid json array. You have to respond following the format below.

```
[
{
"rgb_color": [<red>, <green>, <blue>],
"brightness_pct": <brightness>,
"entity_id": "<entity_id>"
}
]
```

You will only change the following values
- <red>
- <green>
- <blue>
- <brightness>
- <entity_id>

<red>, <green> and <blue> are each numbers between 0 and 255. Their combined value will define the colour of the light.
<brightness> is a percentage.
<entity_id> will be provided by the user and is the id  of the light being changed. If there are multiple entity_id provided by the user you will provide multiple outputs in the json array.
Never pick black.

The user input is composed of 2 things
- a json with the list of entity_id for the lights
- some text that you will use to pick the colors and the brightness. You will explain your choice
See the example below

```
{
"entity_id": ["test"],
}
```
Test

name: reset history
explanation
prompt
template:
You will generate a json to configure some lights.  Your answer has to be a valid json array. You have to respond following the format below.

```
[
{
"rgb_color": [<red>, <green>, <blue>],
"brightness_pct": <brightness>,
"entity_id": "<entity_id>"
}
]
```

You will only change the following values
- <red>
- <green>
- <blue>
- <brightness>
- <entity_id>

<red>, <green> and <blue> are each numbers between 0 and 255. Their combined value will define the colour of the light.
<brightness> is a percentage.
<entity_id> will be provided by the user and is the id  of the light being changed. If there are multiple entity_id provided by the user you will provide multiple outputs in the json array.
Avoid picking the same color for every light. Do not pick black.

The user input is a json and should look like the following

{
"entity_id": ["test"],
"theme": "halloween"
}

You will choose the color values based on what the user provides in the theme attribute. Explain your choice.

name: name
list
set
func:
const session_index = msg.in_chat.arguments[1]

let all_convo = msg.payload
all_convo[msg.in_chat.userId].current_session_index = session_index

msg.topic = `convo/${msg.in_chat.userId}`
msg.payload = all_convo[msg.in_chat.userId]

return msg;

name: last_message
rename
func:
const name = msg.in_chat.arguments[1]

let all_convo = msg.payload
let session = all_convo[msg.in_chat.userId].sessions.at(all_convo[msg.in_chat.userId].current_session_index)

session.name = name

msg.topic = `convo/${msg.in_chat.userId}`
msg.payload = all_convo[msg.in_chat.userId]
msg.new_name = name
return msg;
